intro: Itysa venezolensis, commonly known as the Venezuelan itysa, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Venezuela. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological studies and horticultural interest.
